Scribe Collector Configuration

<store>
   category=_audit
   type=buffer
   tier=collector
   window_size=60
   target_write_size=20480
   max_write_interval=60
   buffer_send_rate=1
   retry_interval=10
   retry_interval_range=10
   replay_buffer=yes
   rotate_if_data=yes
   <primary>
      type=file
      min_file_name=yes
      rotate_on_reopen=yes
      write_stats=yes
      fs_type=hdfs
      file_path=hdfs://<namenode host>:<namenode port>/databus/data/_audit
      create_symlink=no
      use_hostname_sub_directory=yes
      base_filename=_audit
      max_size=128000000
      max_write_size=40960
      rotate_period=1m
      add_newlines=1
      encodeBase64Flag=1
   </primary>
   <secondary>
      type=file
      fs_type=std
      file_path=<spooling directory of scribe collector>/_audit
      base_filename=_audit
      write_stats=yes
      max_size=128000000
  </secondary>
</store>

Note: In production, please apply the entire set of configuration EXACTLY as mentioned above. You can configure the values of following options:

  1. 'retry_interval': MUST be same as in existing HDFS based stores
  2. 'retry_interval_range': MUST be same as in existing HDFS based stores
  3. 'file_path' in <primary> section: MUST be of the format hdfs://<namenode host>:<namenode:port>/databus/system/data/_audit. E.g:- hdfs://localhost:9000/databus/system/data/_audit
  4. 'file_path' in <secondary> section: MUST be of the format <spooling directory of scribe collector>/_audit. E.g:- /var/spool/databus/_audit
